channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children can stay in the U.S. for now, judge says
item.description: A federal district judge issued a temporary restraining order after the U.S. attempted to deport hundreds of unaccompanied Guatemalan children without...

item.title: How Trump is decimating federal employee unions one step at a time
item.description: President Trump has ended collective bargaining rights for more than one million federal workers. Unions have sued to block the move, but agencies are...

item.title: Israel’s New Negotiating Stance Is Likely to Prolong Gaza War, Experts Say
item.description: A shift toward pressing for a permanent cease-fire deal, alongside plans for a new offensive in Gaza City, means the fighting is unlikely to end soon.

item.title: Kyiv Links Moscow to Killing of Former Ukrainian Parliament Speaker
item.description: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the sus...

item.title: Earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing hundreds and destroying villages
item.description: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causi...

item.title: What to Know About the Earthquake in Afghanistan
item.description: Hundreds of people were killed, according to the Taliban government, and the death toll was expected to rise.

item.title: More students head back to class without one crucial thing: their phones
item.description: This back to school season, more districts than ever have cell phone bans in place. Teachers and legislators alike say the restrictions help kids focu...

item.title: Guatemala says it suggested that U.S. send its unaccompanied migrant children home
item.description: As a U.S. federal judge blocked the deportation of unaccompanied Guatemalan children, the government of Guatemala says in a statement it suggested the...

item.title: Xi, Putin and Modi Try to Signal Unity at China Summit
item.description: Their display of friendship in China was aimed at projecting an alternative to U.S. global leadership, even as serious differences among them remain.

item.title: Punjab Floods Devastate Pakistan’s Breadbasket
item.description: Housing communities and businesses that rely on agriculture have been destroyed in the country’s largest province.

item.title: Kyiv Links Moscow to Killing of Former Ukrainian Parliament Speaker
item.description: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the sus...

item.title: Israel’s New Negotiating Stance Is Likely to Prolong Gaza War, Experts Say
item.description: A shift toward pressing for a permanent cease-fire deal, alongside plans for a new offensive in Gaza City, means the fighting is unlikely to end soon.

item.title: A Jamaican Man Served Time in the U.S., Then Was Deported to an African Prison
item.description: The case of Orville Etoria highlights a tension in President Trump’s deportation agenda, in which immigrants can be sent abroad and detained indefinit...

item.title: Putin and Modi Hold Hands as They Greet Xi
item.description: The leaders of Russia, China and India shared a moment of bonhomie at a security summit in eastern China on Monday.
